The figures underscore how Russia's financial sector is bearing the brunt of sanctions that Western countries have imposed on Moscow after its annexation of Crimea and the support they allege the Kremlin has given the armed rebellion in eastern Ukraine.

MOSCOW—Sberbank, Russia’s biggest lender, posted a 25% drop in third-quarter profit on rising provisions for bad loans, as the bank felt the impact of the crisis in Ukraine, Russia's economic stagnation and a weaker ruble.
